label: Survival Months
desc: number of months patient survived (has survived, if patient is still alive)

label: Alive Status
desc: binary variable. 0=dead at end of survival period, 1 means still alive

label: Age at Heart Attack
desc: age in years when heart attack occurred

label: Pericardial Effusion
desc: binary. Pericardial effusion is fluid around the heart. 0=no fluid, 1=fluid

label: Contractility Measure
desc: a measure of contracility around the heart lower numbers are increasingly abnormal

label: E-point Septal Separation
desc: E-point septal separation, another measure of contractility. Larger numbers are increasingly abnormal.

label: Left Ventricular Dimension
desc: left ventricular end-diastolic dimension. This is a measure of the size of the heart at end-diastole. Large hearts tend to be sick hearts.

label: Segment Motion
desc: a measure of how the segments of the left ventricle are moving

label: Wall Motion Index
desc: equals wall-motion-score divided by number of segments seen. Usually 12-13 segments are seen in an echocardiogram. Use this variable INSTEAD of the wall motion score.

label: Derived Var
desc: a derivate var which can be ignored

label: Patient Name
desc: the name of the patient (I have replaced them with "name")

label: 1-Year Survival
desc: Derived from the first two attributes. 0 means patient was either dead after 1 year or had been followed for less than 1 year. 1 means patient was alive at 1 year.
